page.title: 13PEOPLE AT WORK IN S.CRAVEN
page.content: Results of a survey of 500 families. {EMPLOYMENT}Most jobs provided by the Local Authority. The modern Airedale General Hospital provides many part-time and ancillary jobs. Much textile work has gone and new industries have been developed in the old mills e.g. furniture making and light engineering. {TRAVELLING TO WORK}Mostly by car and therefore a decline in Public Transport. 50% of workers travel 5 miles. Distance tending to increase. {MALE AND FEMALE WORKERS}More men than women full-time workers. Most women with families part-time. 1/5 workers have changed type of job. Equal numbers unemployed. {AIRE VALLEY TRUNK ROAD}Proposed new road could increase population of S.Craven villages: make them dormitory areas for Leeds and Bradford.
